title.narrative: PROGRAMME PLANNING AND MONITORING

description.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programmes, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation And Research, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

participating-org.narrative: PROTECTOR OF HUMAN RIGHTS AND FREED
TRUSTEES OF COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY IN THE CITY OF NEW YORK

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programmes

description.narrative: Stakeholder engagement, strategic evidence generation and UN coordination ensured effective programme planning and monitoring. Partners were involved through the UNICEF annual review and planning meeting and UNDAF coordination structures. Continued advocacy led to increased national ownership for the CO evaluation function: key partners were engaged in implementing evaluation recommendations and validating the design of the on-going Country Programme Evaluation. As Co-Chair of the UNDAF Social Inclusion Results Group and Chair of the UN Gender and Human Rights Working Group UNICEF also contributed to UN planning and monitoring supporting a cross-cutting human rights based approach and gender focus. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of relevant staff who have completed relevant learning programmes on gender-responsive programming
Number of relevant staff who have completed relevant learning programmes on result-based programming
Recommendations of Country Programme Evaluation validated with national partners and management (RWP 2019-2020 indicator)

actual.value: 2019:CPE started, national counterparts involved, recommendations to be finalized in 2020

title.narrative: Inception mission and inception report of the Country Programme Evaluation completed

actual.value: 2019:Inception mission was held from 6 to 8 November. The Inception report was submitted and quality assured externally. In addition, the CO and ERG reviewed the report. The final Inception Report will be submitted on January 7, 2020.

title.narrative: Evaluation Reference Group for the Country Programme Evaluation established

actual.value: 2019:The Evaluation Reference Group is established. Terms of Reference were drafted and endorsed during the ERG inaugural meeting in November 2019.

title.narrative: The TOR for the Country Programme Evaluation published and institutional services for conducting the evaluation procured

actual.value: 2019:The Terms of Reference were finalized. Evaluation services were procured and contract signed in October 2019.
